citation.article-title: Proposal of two subspecies of Fusobacterium necrophorum, (Flügge) Moore and Holdeman: Fusobacterium necrophorum subsp. necrophorum subsp. nov., nom. rev. (ex Flugge 1886), and Fusobacterium necrophorum subsp. funduliforme (ex Hallé 1898).

p.s: Description of Fusobacterium necrophorum funduliforme subsp. nov., nom. rev.
Fusobacterium necrophorum subsp. funduliforme (fun.du.li.for’me. L. n. fundula, sausage; L. n. forma, shape; M. L. neut. adj. funduliforme, sausage shaped)
Cells grown in BTY broth are 0.4 to 0.8 by 1 to 8 μm.
Shorter cells (1 to 4 μm) are predominant.
Surface colonies on GAM agar are about 1 mm in diameter, circular with entire margins, grayish, translucent, and raised with smooth surfaces.
Moderate to abundant growth occurs in BTY broth with the production of sediment and no turbidity.
Strain Fn524T is positive for gelatin liquefaction, but negative for H2S production.
The type strain ferments glucose weakly.
Hemagglutination of chicken erythrocytes is negative as determined by the glass slide method, and the hemagglutination titer in test tubes is less than 1:2.
Injection of mice intraperitoneally or intraportally with strains of this subspecies is not lethal; a few focal abscesses are formed in the livers (24).
The G+C content is 27 to 31 mol%.
The type strain of F. necrophorum subsp. fundulgorme subsp. nov., nom. rev. (ex Hallé 1898), is strain Fn524 (= JCM 3724).
